channel.title: moderator rights / staff promotion #2
channel.description:
(Continuation of https://forums.whonix.org/t/moderator-rights-staff-promotion.)
Is there any existing Whonix staff that lacks and privileges?
Any existing Whonix supporters that could use a promotion?
Please feel free to suggest anything here. I don't think we have a existing guidelines for this process, perhaps that's a good thing and makes it more dynamic.

item.title: moderator rights / staff promotion #2
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
torjunkie:

Hi Patrick and Ego,

Thanks for the invite! Sure, why not.

Your welcome!

My main interest is ongoing editing (as you have probably guessed)
and I just want to contribute to Whonix since I’ve been using it for
years, and free-loading off the work of the whole team.

Plus, I’m bored in my current situation.

Privacy is an inalienable right, so I want the documentation to be as
useful and tight as possible to increase the user population, and
increase the security of all Tor users (us included).

My main goal is to work through as much (all?) of the main
documentation as I can this year (maybe excluding all the dev stuff,
since that is huge) and have the Whonix bible looking really nice.

Sounds great!

I don’t intend to do anything different than I do now i.e. edit and
seek feedback on its suitability.

No need to do something different. You’re doing great as is. For that
reason you’re exactly the right person. Would be more red flag if
someone just came here for the admin rights.

Forum mod will be useful so you can move a few posts whenever that is
useful. And wiki admin will be useful if you want to create like new
wiki pages (templates or so).

Do you have a wiki account yet?

Maybe occasional blog posts if you want them. I’m not a technician
like you guys, so I don’t trust myself to get all the details right
on this complex project.

Sure thing!

Thanks for the invite! Sure, why not.

My main interest is ongoing editing (as you have probably guessed) and I just want to contribute to Whonix since I’ve been using it for years, and free-loading off the work of the whole team.

Plus, I’m bored in my current situation.

Privacy is an inalienable right, so I want the documentation to be as useful and tight as possible to increase the user population, and increase the security of all Tor users (us included).

My main goal is to work through as much (all?) of the main documentation as I can this year (maybe excluding all the dev stuff, since that is huge) and have the Whonix bible looking really nice.

I don’t intend to do anything different than I do now i.e. edit and seek feedback on its suitability.

Cheers

item.description:
Ego:

Well, I guess the most active candidate would probably be Torjunkie. I maintain however, as in the past, that with the limited amount of user violations and rare cases in which anyone requires Admin/Mod rights, that it is mostly a recognition, rather than a administrative Thing.

Great! (Not just recognition. torjunkie could use wiki admin rights so new page creation works as well.)

Ego:

Btw. excuse my limited activity lately, had some stuff to take care of with my dog,

No problem and good to know! Btw I’ve been learning about positive reinforcement dog training for a while now.
